intro: Coilonox bruce-bayeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Coilonox bruce-bayeri is often cultivated for its vibrant blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white.
